EU-Mercosur deal: Brussels moves forward, makes a gesture toward France
subhead: The European Commission approved on Wednesday the free trade agreement reached with South American countries in December 2024. The ratification process can now begin, amid growing discontent among farmers.

title: Palestinian students barred from returning to school after Israel shuts down six UN-run schools in East Jerusalem
subhead: Six schools run by the United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees (UNRWA) in the eastern part of the city have been closed by Israeli authorities. Nearly 600 children now face being left out of school.
byline: By Luc Bronner (Shuafat refugee camp (East Jerusalem), special correspondent)

title: It's pain suisse time! Five places in the Paris region to find this treat
subhead: The recipe for this comforting pastry, enjoyed as a snack or at breakfast? Croissant dough, vanilla custard and chocolate chips. Here is our selection of Parisian bakeries offering the best versions.

title: Julia Kristeva, psychoanalyst and writer: 'The Trumpist deal is the complete absence of the social contract'
subhead: 'May '68 Thinkers Reflect On Trump Era (4/6). The author analyzes the current political climate, shaped by the ambitions of American and Russian leaders, but also by 'woke-ism' and a 'national depression.'

title: After years on the sidelines, France's Socialists are having a moment
subhead: Prime Minister François Bayrou's impending downfall stems from his inability to win over the Socialists. They now face a difficult choice between finding an agreement with Macron's coalition or maintaining a stance of radical opposition, observes Le Monde columnist Françoise Fressoz.

title: French budget minister: 'France cannot go an entire year without a budget'
subhead: With the French government at risk of collapsing, Amélie de Montchalin says in an interview that the deadline to submit a draft budget to the Assemblée Nationale is October 13. Any later and a special law would be required to avoid a shutdown, which she sees as a problematic last resort.
byline: Interview by Denis Cosnard and Mariama Darame

title: Thomas Piketty: 'To succeed in the climate transition, we must redistribute wealth differently'
subhead: In an interview with Le Monde, the French economist explains that protecting the planet from climate change cannot be achieved without reducing inequality.
byline: Interview by Nabil Wakim and Cécile Cazenave
